page.title: 01A RURAL RETREAT
page.content: This Domesday block is a rural area with three commuter villages; Collingham, East Keswick,Linton.The area is divided by the River Wharfe which flows west to east.The Barsdey- Collingham Beck flows into the Wharfe creating in all two shallow valleys to meet in Collingham.Two roads follow these valleys to meet in Collingham .The A58 Leeds-Wetherby road is the main artery through the block.The Crossgates-Wetherby railway passed through Collingham and East Keswick until its closure in 1965.The highest point is in the south of the area about 350 feet above sea level.The view from here is of pleasant well managed farm land dotted with housing estates.This is a rural retreat to the east of the West Yorkshire conurbation of Leeds and Bradford.The living is clean.
